column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Use the Rear View Mirror
#Text=While driving a car , it is important to keep an eye on all the traffic around you .
#Text=This will help you to know what drivers around you are doing .
#Text=It will also help you keep track of when it is safe for you to make lane changes or turns .

#Text=In order to keep a good eye on the road around you , you will need to adjust the rearview mirror inside the car before starting to drive and then look at the mirror at specific times while driving .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Adjusting the Mirror
#Text=Position your seat .
#Text=Before you adjust your mirror , you want to make sure that your seat is in the right position for driving .
#Text=Move the seat forward or back , adjust the seat back , and move the seat up or down , if your seat has that type of adjustment .
#Text=It 's important to adjust the seat so that you can easily reach the pedals of the car .
#Text=Make sure your feet can reach the gas pedal , the brake pedal , and if you have one , the clutch pedal .
#Text=Buckle your seatbelt .
#Text=With your seatbelt buckled , you will be in your final driving position .
#Text=If you adjust your mirrors before buckling your seatbelt , you may be in a different position when actually driving .
#Text=It is important for your safety to always drive with your seatbelt buckled .
#Text=Move the rearview mirror .
#Text=You want to assure that you can see the traffic behind you clearly .
#Text=You should be able to see the road behind you , with the horizon line and a bit of the space above the horizon line visible as well .
#Text=To be able to do this , make sure that you can see your whole rear window in your rearview mirror .
#Text=To adjust the mirror simply move the body of the mirror to a different angle .
#Text=The mirror should move easily , although not so easily that it falls out of place once you position it .
#Text=Do n't adjust the mirror so that you can see out one side of the rear window more than another .
#Text=This will only limit your overall vision of the road .
#Text=If you are concerned about seeing one side of the car , you should use your side view mirrors for that .
#Text=Make small adjustments while stopped .
#Text=If you feel that your mirror needs additional adjustment after you start driving , make this adjustment while stopped .
#Text=It can be a hazard to adjust the mirror while in motion , as you should be focused on your driving and the traffic around you .
#Text=While driving , the vibration of the vehicle can cause the position of the rearview mirror to change .
#Text=Pay attention to its position as you drive and adjust it as needed when stopped .
#Text=Adjust your mirror every time you drive .
#Text=To be safe , take the time to adjust the rearview mirror before every drive .
#Text=It is not enough to rely on your positioning from the last time you drove .
#Text=You may have been sitting in a slightly different position or someone else could have adjusted the mirror without you knowing .
#Text=Using the Mirror While Driving
#Text=Check your rearview mirror on a regular basis .
#Text=Even if you are just driving straight ahead on an open highway , it 's important to know what is going on behind you .
#Text=This means you should be looking at your rearview mirror every 5-8 seconds .
#Text=This will keep your understanding of the traffic conditions behind you up to date .
#Text=It will also allow you to keep track of cars that are passing you , and even cars that are acting sporadically or dangerously behind you .
#Text=Look in your rearview mirror before adjusting your position on the road .
#Text=You should look in the mirror before you stop or start , pass a car , turn , switch lanes , pull over , or make any other adjustment to your position on the road .
#Text=Basically , if you want to make any movements , other than straight ahead , you should check your rearview mirror before doing it , so that you can make the change safely .

#Text=When changing lanes , you use a combination of your rearview mirror and your side mirror to see if where you are moving is clear , as well as turning around to see if there is anyone in your blind spot .
#Text=The combination of all of these checks will make switching lanes safer .
#Text=Use your rearview mirror when backing up .
#Text=The rear-view mirror is especially important when you are moving your vehicle in reverse .
#Text=The mirror will help you to know the course is clear and that you can move without coming into contact with another car , person , or property .
#Text=When moving in reverse , it is also important to rely on things other than the rear-view mirror .
#Text=Check your side mirrors and turn around and look behind the car with your own eyes in order to assess the situation .
#Text=After all , it is always better to be safe than sorry .
#Text=Look at your rearview mirror when navigating heavy or irregular traffic .
#Text=The rearview mirror can give you a lot of good information when trying to get through a stressful and busy driving situation .
#Text=For example , look in your mirror to assess whether moving in reverse will help you get out of a tight space or just lock you into an even more tenuous position .
#Text=Look before you make a quick stop if you can .
#Text=Before you brake hard , take a quick second to assess whether any cars are too close to your rear end to stop .
#Text=If that is the case , consider adjusting your lane or your braking speed if you can .
#Text=If you ca n't , then knowing a car behind you may hit you will give you a second to brace for an impact .
#Text=If you are looking in your rearview mirror at regular intervals already , you may already have a good idea if a vehicle is close behind you .
#Text=This will help you to make a quick judgement about the following distance and if a vehicle will have time to stop before hitting you .
#Text=Being good at judging the following distance of vehicles behind you should help you adjust your braking measures in order to prevent a rear-end collision from happening .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you are driving at night , you might want to use the anti-glare function of your rearview mirror .
#Text=This will help to reduce the light from headlights behind you that are reflected into your eyes .
#Text=Use the tilt function of the mirror to switch to this anti-glare function .
